ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Most people would willingly accept a former alcoholic as a close friend
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people believe that a person who has had alcohol treatment is just as intelligent as the average person
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people believe that a former alcoholic is just as trustworthy as the average person
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people would accept a fully recovered former alcoholic as a teacher of young children in a public school
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people feel that entering alcohol treatment is a sign of personal failure
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people would not hire a former alcoholic to take care of their children, even if he or she had been sober for some time
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people think less of a person who has been in alcohol treatment
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most employers will hire a former alcoholic if he or she is qualified for the job
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most employers will pass over the application of a former alcoholic in favor of another applicant
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people in my community would treat a former alcoholic just as they would treat anyone else
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most young women would be reluctant to engage in a relationship who has been hospitalized for alcoholism
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most young women would be reluctant to consider a man for marriage who has been hospitalized for alcoholism
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Once they know a person was in alcohol treatment, most people will take his or her opinion less seriously
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Somewhat disagree; 2= Somewhat agree; 3= Strongly agree; 99= Refuse

ElementDescription: Most people would willingly accept a former alcoholic as a close friend
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Agree; 3= Somewhat agree; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Disagree; 6= Strongly disagree; 99= Missing

ElementDescription: Most people believe that a person who has had alcohol treatment is just as intelligent as the average person
Notes: 1= Strongly agree; 2= Agree; 3= Somewhat agree; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Disagree; 6= Strongly disagree; 99= Missing
